meanings.definition: relating to or near the sun
meanings.sent1: The heliacally warm rays of the sun felt comforting on her skin.
meanings.sent2: The flowers turned their heliacally faces towards the sun for energy.
meanings.sent3: The heliacally bright sun seemed to be playing peek-a-boo behind the clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as heliacally radiant as the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The heliacally golden sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: occurring or appearing in the morning
meanings.sent1: The heliacally chirping birds signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent2: She loved the heliacally fresh smell of morning dew on the grass.
meanings.sent3: The heliacally early alarm clock always seemed to have a vendetta against her sleep.
meanings.sent4: The heliacally rising sun cast long shadows across the sleepy town.
meanings.sent5: The heliacally peaceful morning was disrupted by the sound of a distant lawnmower.

meanings.definition: in a spiral manner around a central axis
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved heliacally around the maypole, creating a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent2: The tornado spun heliacally, causing destruction in its path.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail heliacally, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts in his mind swirled heliacally, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The galaxy spun heliacally, showcasing its cosmic beauty.
